demographics1_info1 = [[Bhojpuri language|Bhojpuri]], [[Hindi language|Hindi]], [[Urdu language|Urdu]] | blank2_name_sec1 = [[Lok Sabha]] constituency | blank2_info_sec1 = [[Valmiki Nagar (Lok Sabha constituency)|Valmiki Nagar]] | blank3_name_sec1 = [[Vidhan Sabha]] constituency | blank3_info_sec1 = [[Bagaha (Vidhan Sabha constituency)|Bagaha]] }} '''Bagaha''' is a city and a [[municipality]] in [[West Champaran district|Pashchim Champaran]] district in the state of [[Bihar]], [[India]]. It is [[Subdivisions of India|Subdivision]] of Pashchim Champaran district and is Police District. It is located around {{convert|64|km}} away from its [[List of districts of Bihar|district headquarters]] [[Bettiah]] towards north-west. It is 294 kilometers away from its state capital [[Patna]].
==Demographics== {{As of|2011}} India [[census]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.census2011.co.in/census/city/158-bagaha.html | title=Bagaha City Population Census 2011}}</ref> Bagaha had a population of 112,634. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Bagaha has an average literacy rate of 38%, lower than the national average of 59.5%; with 66% of the males and 34% of females literate. 19% of the population is under 6 years of age. Bagaha is located on the bank of River Gandak and near the Valmiki Tiger Reserve.
==See also== *[[Mehura]] *[[Pipariya, Bihar]]
